remarks: A product of commutative rings is a commutative ring.  Since the resulting ring will have zero divisors in all nontrivial cases, this cannot be strengthened much further.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Mar-2015.)
statement:
prdscrngd.y $e |- Y = ( S Xs_ R ) $.
prdscrngd.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. W ) $.
prdscrngd.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. V ) $.
prdscrngd.r $e |- ( ph -> R : I --> CRing ) $.
prdscrngd $p |- ( ph -> Y e. CRing ) $.
